caption: Very tasty. Will come back for the pizza only.

Ambiance, Food & Service were 10/10!  Came here for lunch and tried the prixe fix for $18. It comes with a side of fresh lemon Parmesan arugula salad and a margarita pie OR choice of pasta. I got the mushroom pasta with spinach pappardelle pasta and it was creamy but not too heavy - the perfect balance! I wish I took pictures but I ate it all up too fast. 😃  Would definitely come back again for lunch and also look forward to visiting again to try their dinner menu!
I wasnt impressed by the food at all. I was excited to go but the food was average at best.
Incredibly good! I didn't expect to like southern italian food this much considering how much I like northern italian food haha but check it out.
Tuna Pinsa incredible. So light and fluffy. Must try
No words! PINSA ROMANA BETTER THAN ROME
great food all around

Delicious and laid back Italian restaurant on the outskirts of Williamsburg. This is an authentic Italian restaurant, with fresh ingredients and quality service. While I didn’t order the famous piñata, I did come here for my birthday meal!  I ordered the Cauliflower Skillet that was incredibly savory and delicious, perfect for a vegetarian or anybody who would rather avoid eggs at breakfast. Other menu highlights were the Eggs Benedict. We weren’t crazy about the Brioche French Toast, personally.  The drinks were excellent here as well! The cocktail menu has an extensive speciality list and plenty of classics to keep everybody happy. I cannot wait to come back!!
The food, drinks, and service were excellent! Everything is absolutely delicious. The service was was also amazing, shoutout to Francesco!  Try the pinsas, squash and carbonara pasta
Guys if you think about neapolitan pizza forgive that: the best roman pinsa ever, better than Rome!
Really tasty pizza, breath of fresh air within the Brooklyn landscape. Great $18 lunch special as well.
My husband and I are both pizza lovers and came across this delicious pizza a few months ago , we come any chance we get! There is no better tasting pizza in all of NYC! The staff is amazing as well!
In door dining with soft contact tracing protocols (only 1 person required to complete). Delicious food and nice atmosphere. Nice staff and good service.
Great atmosphere, friendly staff and amazing food..top notch 👍🏾👌🏾
Amazing place. The food was excellent and the outdoor garden was so romantic.
Very good food, great setting, good staff
I think he's a very good app and I will recommend it
Great! Can't wait to visit you again
(Translated by Google) Pinsa !!!  (Original) Pinsa!!!
The best (and the warmest here outdoor seating in NYC during covid. Always friendly and amazing experience in general. Highly recommend their margarita!

Got the dry aged ribeye and one of the pizzas - absolutely phenomenal. Restaurant staff were very friendly, crowd was great, and the outdoor seating on the street was perfectly warm. One complaint is that one of the space heaters on the street side was emitting a continuous high pitched ringing - if that’s fixed I’ll be back very soon.
Beautiful outdoor patio and amazing food. Get the squash with the spiced honey. The pizzas are also delicious
Best outdoor heaters in NYC and food was great
The food was amazing
Nice garden setting that felt safe and ventilated during COVID but also warm. Really great pasta, friendly staff.
Don't even know where to begin. Such a gem. The food is out of this WORLD. As is the service and ambiance.  Get the butternut squash ravioli, plus the ragu bolognese. Highly highly recommend.

Moved into the neighborhood recently and so happy we have Montesacro nearby. Went on a date nigh in late September and the backyard was beautiful. Great setup, food, and service! For this lowkey thanksgiving we ordered takeout and everything was SO GOOD. The burrata and the Ragu were highlights!! We enjoyed our meal and we will certainly continue supporting this business.
Great ambiance especially given the current circumstances related to the COVID pandemic. Food is well prepared and the servers and friendly
Great!
Best Italian in Williamsburg.
Everything is top quality when dining in. My only complaint is that when I get a pinsa delivered it is noticeably smaller and not assembled with as much love as the ones they serve in house.
My favorite Italian restaurant in the city ! Their suppli are just the best ! Pinsas and pastas are always amazing ! And the restaurant is wonderful
Soooo wonderful. A large, safe backyard space and the same wonderful menu as always. Split a pinsa, a steak and a bottle of wine. It will take the sting out of the pandemic!
Great Covid safe back porch area little pricey great food
(Translated by Google) Great Artesanal Pizza 🍕  (Original) Great Artesanal Pizza 🍕
Amazing service!! And food!! And cocktails! And the backyard?? Dream restaurant!! Thank you Montesacro, you nailed it!!!

They made the restaurant's covid19 layout  with clear panel between tables, be inviting and intimate. You don't feel "enclosed", you feel safe. The food and cocktails were tasty.  Our waitress was funny and nice. This restaurant is pricey. The food and service was good, but expensive.
Great food. Awesome venue and covid safe precautions. As close to "normal" dining you can get right now.

Our favorite restaurant in the neighborhood!!! The pinsa is totally something else (way better than regular pizza) and the chef Luca is so nice and we can see he puts passion in what he does!! We totally recommend the Finchi salad and Quadrado pinsa, but all the food is delicious and really good quality!!! We eat here at least once a week and we always come back 😅 feels like family now!!  Totally recommended!!!
Food and service was good. As per covid 19 guidelines, staff were in masks and tables were at an appropriate distance. They had plexiglass in between tables as well.
Good authentic Italian food, good service, all for a fair price. Will definitely go back

This is my first time giving a 1 star review. Went here as part of a larger group with two individuals allergic to nuts. When placing the order we informed our server Edoardo of the nut allergy in both English and Italian. However, we were brought salads with hazel nuts which were nearly eaten. We understand that mistakes can be made but in this case the issue with the situation was the distasteful manner in which the manager Stefano handled the monumental error. The food is decent, the restaurant clearly specializes in pizza making. The cocktail drinks were lackluster however the ambiance is stellar with excellent outdoor seating. Our disappointment was in the manager Stefano's refusal to take responsibility for the error and his decision to escalate the situation instead of rectifying it: I have rarely witnessed such rude and unprofessional behavior. On a separate note, Stefano was the only individual in the restaurant not wearing his mask or not wearing it properly.
Pleasant garden setting, friendly staff and great food

I think this place needs to be seen. The food is amazing and the atmosphere on the patio is incredibly welcoming.  The drink service was slow but they only had one bartender - who can blame them.  Try the flatbreads that seems out of your comfort zone! We tried the one with tuna and it was by far my favorite. A  We will be coming back for wine and a cheese plate next time!
Outstanding!! I'll be back!

Beautiful modern italian food. Everything is fresh and delicious. The pinsas are perfection, the cacio e pepe is on point, and the tiramisu is flawless. Much needed authentic italian food in bk. The ambiance is delightfully curated with pleasant lively music, a gorgeous setting, a beautiful open kitchen, and a lovely attentive staff. I had the pleasure of staging here in the kitchen and the cooks are a very unique and passionate bunch. Finally had time to eat dinner there and it exceeded my expectations.
The most amazing food in New York! Even in Italy this would be high level food!

Amazing. Really well thought of. I enjoyed it tremendously and even my fiancée said it was a good move going there. We had pizza (epic) as a starter then I had the carbonara one, was really remarkable. She had the truffle pasta that was also extremity well done and the pasta it's self for both was really on point. Drinks were strong and well. This place is really worth your time and money. And I do not say this lightly. Thank you for a great evening y'all!
Light airy pizzas. Love it.
They have a wonderful patio in the back, great service and the pizzas are great!

They have amazing pizza there. Interesting toppings and perfect texture from the dough. I can tell how serious they are from the menu descriptions of the dough. They will tell you how long they have prove the dough, the water percentage, and exactly what ingredients are there. I do wish they have an alternative option: the regular wheat flour dough, so my soy allergic husband can try the pizza.  In addition, their soft drink products are imported from Italy. Interesting selections and tastes. Recommend to try.
Authentic Roman trattoria, their pinsas are spectacular. On the downside, service was a bit slow,but they had a busy night. Nice outdoor gazebo.
I absolutely love this place! The outdoor space in the back is 100% heavenly :-)
Cacio e Pepe pasta was authentic and delcious. They have a small outdoors dinnig space on the street for dining in during lockdown.
This place has the most AUTHENTIC Italian food I've EVER tasted. The ambiance is inviting and friendly. I LOVE this place and they will see me again SOON!
Nice place in the backyard...good food
possibly the most bland foods i’ve ever tried
Hidden gem.  Stumbled upon this place by accident.  Highly recommend it.  Great great great food.  Did I mention the food is great?
Come for the pizza (pinsa) stay for the Negronis (which are great for takeout too)
Amazingly delicious food and drinks.

A favorite of mine, taking over the space of the beloved DuMont. I hope Montesacro becomes another local gem for brunch.  During COVID, they are doing delivery through DoorDash and caviar, and seemingly have some Italian goodies! According to the sign in their window:  "We now sell pinsa bread, focaccia, ciambelline, olive oil, guanciale, salame, buffalo mozzarella, pecorino, italian sodas & more!"
The customer service was amazing!! I loved the food and the recommendations of the staff are perfect 🤩🥰 Nice place, nice food !!
They advertise happy hour draft beers $5 but when we got there,  only one draft beer was $5. We ended up paying $10 per beer.  It's not the price that annoyed me but the false advertising.
Good food nice place
Awesome food and great ambiance.
I've never eaten something I didn't like here and the skylight room is adorable ❤️
What a wonderful restaurant experience! From the ambiance to the waitstaff to the perfect food. Everything was so beautiful, unique and full of flavor. Can’t wait to go back!
Menu was pricey. Service was excellent

Sat in the garden room. It was lovely! The decor was wonderful and the food and wine we're both very very good. Our server was a little odd but that's no demerit to the restaurant. Take someone you care about, because it'll be a lovely experience. Share a bottle of wine, an app, and some pasta. Share each other's company, and have a wonderful night.

I use to go to this address long time ago when it was Dumont, one of the first cool place that opened in the area, always loved that place with the big patio in the back. I am so glad that Montesacro took over that spot. Food is great, atmosphere is great, stuff is great overall I am going back next week ;) Don’t worry if you see no one sitting in the front of the restaurant everyone is in the back patio so don’t be hesitant to get into an empty place... I am vegetarian and they have delicious options. Can’t wait for spring and enjoy the opened patio.
This is one of the best new additions to Williamsburg. Delicious pinsas , fresh ingredients, great service, and wonderful decor.
Their secret, fluffy light pizza dough makes the so-called pinsa a special treat

Always a wonderful experience at Montesacro. This is my go-to spot for Italian food. The service was excellent, but most importantly, the food was as amazing as always. Make a reservation or show up early, it gets really busy.

(Translated by Google) An excellent Italian for Sunday brunch, especially with pinzas. Ask to be placed in the covered garden  (Original) Un excellent italien pour le brunch du dimanche, notamment avec les pinzas. Demandez à être placés dans le jardin couvert
Great food, spacious environment

Nice ambiance and good addition to the area. Maybe because they are recently open and still working out kinks but we waited about 50 minutes between antipasti and entree. Our server Nolan was very good and attentive and made up for it. The pizza is really goo li and prices are reasonable. Place reminds me a little of Aurora.

Cute new place in Williamsburg!! Right near the metropolitan Ave stop so really easy to get to from the L.  First off, the decor is really nice. The restaurant has a back seating area that has windows along every wall and a glass ceiling. We came here during dinner time so it was dark and they had lights which was pretty, but I’m sure the natural sunlight during the day would be amazing too.  For food we ordered the Margherita and the one with honey and guancale pizza. We also got the carbonara. The pasta was ok. Not much flavor just lots of pepper. Glad the pasta wasn’t overcooked though. The pizzas, however, were amazing. They’re Roman style so the dough is a bit different. It’s lighter on the stomach and has less fat and calories apparently. The pizzas are pretty big and they give you a pizza slicer so you can cut it to however many pieces you want.
Dont let the front fool you, go to the back. Amazing food, loved the pinsa, will be back

I had an amazing time sitting at the bar chatting with Stephen and Sean who guided me to enjoy the Quadraro Pinsa and a well paired Navarra Garciano wine (2016). The pinsa was absolutely dynamite. A good mixture of salt (pork cheek) and spice (Calabrian), and I can’t wait to try the pasta here. Not only do they have an amazing tin ceiling and open kitchen concept, but they have a massive backyard that has a retractable glass roof that one can enjoy during the cold months as well during the not so fun rainy season of NYC. This is a must for a fun date sport in the area as this place is littered with dive bars and if you are feeling like things are going well, this will definitely seal the deal! 11/10 will definitely come back. Great staff, good food, good wine selections and constantly changing menus.
Awesome real Italian food. One if the best Italian places I've been for a long time. Very tasty food and great drinks!
(Translated by Google) Excellent Pinza and delizoosa pasta  (Original) Ottima Pinsa e pasta deloziosa
(Translated by Google) The food and the excellent place  (Original) La comida y el lugar excelente

Excellent restaurant featuring Roman pinsa.  Pinsa is like pizza, but with crust made from rice, soy, and wheat flour.  The crust is lighter and less filling than regular all-flour crust.  The space is a row house in Williamsburg, including an extension to the dining area constructed in the garden.  Friendly and competent service.  Excellent food.  Walking distance from two subway lines.
Unassuming place with an adorable greenhouse feel and amazing food! Of course the pinse was to die for! Thanks Andrea and Sonya!
(Translated by Google) Magnificent  (Original) Magnifico

High quality ingredients and nice atmosphere in this pizza (but just not that) place. The difference with other pizzerias is that Montesacro offers the roman version of the pizza; similar to a focaccia. Good also the list of wines, personally I recommend Cesanese del Piglio; not so common in NY and delicious.

Great place . The hostess was super nice (rare sight in Williamsburg) , and waitress was even nicer ! And gave us great recommendations. food is delicious!!! Amazing cozy space . Definitely will be back . Took the frittata and French toast ! Super yummy!!!
Shout out to My fave people GG and Steve and Cianna...luv u guys!!  Service, food, ambience.....excellent!!  Thanks Emmanuel for bringing Montesacro to Williamsburg!!
Amazing staff, food and vibe
We made reservations for Sunday evening. The bartender and staff were friendly and helpful. The Maranella flatbread was delicious.
Good food in a relaxed environment. Highly recommend.
It's only a matter of time before this restaurant is discovered and reservations will be impossible. Intimate environment offering incredible pinsa and delicious pasta.

A lovely, cozy well run Italian restaurant. Great food, great service great space!  Oct '19 edit:  At the risk of sounding like a broken record, go and go again. It's a rare thing to find an NYC restaurant with perfect service, a lovely ambiance, great food AND a menu that changes. Montesacro ticks all these boxes and more. And on top of that, not that you deserve that too, it has a great international wine list and a GM who knows his stuff. Truly a wonderful expereince.

Residing in the old Dumont's wonderful space, Montesacro is a welcome addition to the neighborhood. The food was top notch, and I wanted so many of the options on the menu that I'll definitely be returning soon.

This place is such a great addition to the neighborhood!  I kind of don’t want anyone to know so finding a table won’t be hard...  Food is 5 stars.  Everything we had was delicious: Bucatini, pizza (the dough is to die for), appetizers, and seasonal dessert tart.  The restaurant has a beautiful outdoor space in the back with a retractable roof.  Go here before the secret gets out!
(Translated by Google) Pinza votes 10  (Original) Pinza voti 10
The food here is excellent, I highly recommend the pinsas - can’t wait to come back.
Hard to find better cheese and meats. Tried the coppa di testa, porchetta, gorgonzola, and got my mind blown. Pasta and pinsa are just as good. Vibe and service are excellent as well!
Excellent pizza

I highly recommend the Pinsa which is similar to a pizza. I had the Casal Bertone which is like a white pizza with yummy bacon, mozzarella and honey! So good and plenty to share with another person or take home leftovers. I also tasted the Cacio e Pepe pasta dish a classic simple dish but very good and cheesy. Both were delicious and I would definitely go back and bring friends and family back here again to try more dishes. Lastly the service was exceptional, I love to ask about favorite dishes and the waitress was happy to share more about her favorite dishes and went above and beyond to make sure we had water and were happy.

Outstanding love for the food and wine make this authentic Roman restaurant an instant classic. Stepping out into the garden/winter garden part in the back is like stepping out of city. A perfect spot to share an evening with friends.

Everything was delicious. We had steak and eggs, steak was super soft even well done, avocado toast, french toast was super and the burger was amazing! Place looks contemporary and music was great although I would say music was for a younger crowd.

Such a hidden gem! The backyard seating area  is designed beautifully. Trust me when I say it is not an over exaggeration that everything on the menu is delicious. The staff is very knowledgeable of the the menu and very accommodating. Officially my new favorite neighborhood restaurant!
Lovely back patio, great service and delicious pizza!

Having a reservation at 8:30 PM on Friday the incompetent hostess told us that we will have to wait for 15 to 20 minutes or more The restaurant does not have liquor yet Another minus for a new place My friend was with a cane and she did not even offer a seat Thanks god we were told that this place is from the people of Aurora I never liked this last one since it is not italian at all We end up having our dinner at Lighthouse with great cocktails food and service
Great food, ambiance, and staff. My credit card was charged an extra 20% despite leaving a 20% cash tip and writing cash on the tip section of the merchant copy of my bill. That’s my only complaint.
Phenominal service,friendly staff and amazing food.
Very good food, nice place, and excellent service
Gorgeous covered courtyard, delicious and authentic food, and great service.

Really, really good food. Maybe even great. We definitely enjoyed our time in the expansive back garden area and the BYOB was a nice plus, though that won't last long. Only docking a star because Montesacro's price:food quantity ratio is a little off - the kale Caesar salad and Cacio e Pepe we ordered were tiny, and the specialty truffle pizza (also not so large) was priced at $28. But we'll be back because the neighborhood has nothing comparable, and everything tastes great.
SO good. Food was well seasoned, service was great, can’t wait to go back!
Unique flavors that are complex and comforting
Great backyard, great food, attentive and knowledgeable servers. It’s apparently from the owner of Aurora, my favorite place in Williamsburg!!!! I’ll be back soon!
Beautiful space (garden in the rear is a dream) with authentic Roman cuisine not to be missed!
Service was exceptional. Back garden ambience was gorgeous. The Pinsa was to die for! Great addition to the neighborhood and soo excited to come back.
